meanings.definition: A person who creates a list of individuals or entities to be excluded or punished.
meanings.sent1: The blacklister made a list of people who were not allowed to enter the club.
meanings.sent2: The school blacklister added the troublemakers to the list of students not allowed at the event.
meanings.sent3: The blacklister jokingly added the teacher to the list of students who needed to stay after class.
meanings.sent4: The blacklister's list was like a shield, protecting the community from troublemakers.
meanings.sent5: The blacklister's list was as strict as a locked gate, keeping out those who misbehaved.

meanings.definition: To put someone on a list of individuals or entities to be excluded or punished.
meanings.sent1: She decided to blacklister her former friend after the betrayal.
meanings.sent2: The company blacklisted the vendor for providing poor quality products.
meanings.sent3: He threatened to blacklister anyone who didn't follow the rules of the group project.
meanings.sent4: The decision to blacklister the troublemaker was like drawing a line in the sand.
meanings.sent5: The manager's choice to blacklister the unreliable employee was a clear message to the team.
